task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block, align the circular end-effector, make gentle planar contact, then push the block toward the goal and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop pushing task: a robot arm with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a white workspace until it reaches a small goal mark. The sequence emphasizes visual detection, top-down approach, precise in-plane alignment, controlled contact, repeated straight pushes, and a safe retreat. The frames show the block starting left of the goal and the arm approaching from above before executing a rightward push. Timing is moderate; actions are tuned with conservative timeouts and precise alignment tolerance.
preconditions: Workspace clear; block and goal mark visible
End-effector free (gripper open) and above table
stepwise_plan: Scan and detect the T-block and its pose
Move above the block and align push direction
Lower until light contact is detected
Execute three push segments toward the goal
success_criteria: Block final pose within a small radius of the goal mark
No loss of contact with table; no collisions
Robot ends in a safe, retracted configuration
failure_and_recovery: If the block is not detected: rescan the area
If contact is not detected: re-approach and lower again
If the push deviates: realign and repeat a shorter push
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after retreat once pushes are executed or if any action times out/fails irrecoverably.

frame_3.now_evidence: Tool is aligned and just above the block; onset of contact phase is visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Push actuation should follow immediately along the alignment axis.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Ensure tool is open and non-interfering before planar push.
Search the workspace for the block.
Pre-approach above the block at safe height.
Orient tool so push direction is along workspace +X.
Gently establish planar contact with the block.
Execute a straight push segment toward the goal.
Back off to a safe standoff after pushing.

failure_modes: Block not detected due to glare/occlusion
Insufficient contact (no motion) or excessive force (block rotates)
recovery_strategy: Re-approach and realign if slip is observed
Repeat shorter push segments after re-alignment
Abort and retreat on repeated timeouts
assumptions: Frames show a RED T-block and a BLUE circular goal; instruction mentions gray/green/blue. Visual evidence preferred.
Push direction assumed toward workspace +X (rightward) with three 0.1 m segments; actual distance may vary per episode.
10 Hz observation/control noted but not directly mappable to library timeouts (bins start at 400 ms).

expected_success_criteria: Block center within ~1â€“2 cm of the goal circle
